students.name: Lekishon
students.bio: Lekishon is a bright and curious 14-year-old from a small village in Rombo. He dreams of becoming a veterinarian to care for his family's cattle. He loves playing soccer with his friends but is often shy when speaking English, though he is eager to learn and share stories about his culture.

students.name: Naserian
students.bio: Naserian, 16, is a passionate reader who walks over an hour to get to school each day. She faces challenges accessing books but hopes to become a teacher to inspire other girls in her community. She would love to practice her conversational skills to gain confidence in class discussions.

students.name: Sankale
students.bio: Sankale is 15 and has a remarkable talent for drawing the wildlife around his home. He struggles to afford art supplies and wants to improve his English to one day sell his art and share the beauty of his homeland with the world. He is friendly but needs encouragement to speak.

students.name: Tepilit
students.bio: Tepilit, 17, is fascinated by science and technology but has limited access to resources. He is currently in a call but is looking forward to future conversations. Improving his English is his top priority for pursuing a science degree.

students.name: Kaelo
students.bio: Kaelo is a natural storyteller who loves sharing tales passed down through generations. He is currently booked but is excited to share his stories in future calls.

students.name: Moipa
students.bio: Moipa, 15, enjoys helping on his family's farm and wants to learn about sustainable agriculture. He is looking to improve his English to connect with agricultural experts online.

students.name: Naisiae
students.bio: Naisiae is a talented artist who creates beautiful Maasai beadwork. She wants to learn English to share her craft with a global audience and potentially start her own online shop.

students.name: Lemayian
students.bio: A gifted long-distance runner, Lemayian aspires to compete professionally. He knows that speaking English fluently is essential for international travel and competition.

students.name: Yiantoi
students.bio: Yiantoi has a beautiful voice and loves traditional Maasai songs. She's currently in a call but is excited to practice English to write her own songs in multiple languages.

students.name: Siman
students.bio: Siman is fascinated by how computers work. He hopes to become a software developer and create apps that can help his community. He needs better English to understand coding tutorials.

students.name: Naneu
students.bio: Naneu loves learning traditional recipes from her grandmother. She wants to improve her English to one day write a cookbook that shares her culture's cuisine with the world.

students.name: Mpoke
students.bio: Mpoke enjoys listening to the stories of village elders and is passionate about preserving his heritage. He wants to learn English to document these stories for future generations.

students.name: Siantayo
students.bio: Siantayo is a natural leader and loves helping younger children with their lessons. Her goal is to become a primary school teacher, and she knows strong English skills are essential.

students.name: Lanoi
students.bio: Lanoi has a sharp mind and excels in her school's debate club. She wants to hone her English to compete at a national level and advocate for her community's needs.

students.name: Tatiana
students.bio: Tatiana is passionate about protecting the local environment and its wildlife. She aims to study conservation and believes fluent English will help her collaborate with international organizations.

students.name: Olen'kain
students.bio: Olen'kain is skilled with his hands and enjoys fixing things around his home. He wants to become an engineer and needs to improve his technical English to study textbooks and manuals.

students.name: Nolari
students.bio: Nolari dreams of becoming a nurse to help her community, which has limited access to healthcare. She is dedicated to her studies and wants to improve her English to attend medical school.

students.name: Meto
students.bio: Meto is a young entrepreneur who helps his family sell goods at the local market. He believes learning English will help him expand their business and connect with more customers.

students.name: Naisula
students.bio: Naisula expresses herself through poetry, writing about her daily life and Maasai traditions. She wants to improve her English to share her work with a wider audience and read poets from other cultures.

students.name: Letur
students.bio: Letur loves looking at the night sky and learning about the stars. He wants to study astronomy and knows that most scientific research is published in English.
